text.author: Arizona Court of Appeals
text.title: Arizona Court of Appeals McCombs v. Miller - Case No. 22-0634
text.summary: Amy Sells, representing appellants Chase and Chelsea McCombs, argues that Debbie did not die in the fire at her house because she stayed to fight it and couldn't leave through the front door, which was double deadbolt locked in violation of statute, but, based on burns consistent with some furniture, may have fallen into a burning chair on an alternative escape route.
